clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Probiotic on Constipation With Diverse Stool Consistency
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Lactobacillus Casei Strain Shirota on Constipation With Diverse Stool Consistency

brief_summary.textblock: Constipation of different etiology might respond differently to probiotic intervention. Lactobacillus casei strain Shirota (LcS) is a well-studied probiotic which effectively alleviate constipation. Constipation subjects were recruited according to ROME Ⅲ criteria. According to Bristol Stool Form Scale (BS), subjects were divided into 3 groups: hard stool (HS, BS<3), normal stool (NS, 3≤BS≤4) and soft stool (SS, 4<BS<5). Subjects consumed 100mL per day of a probiotic beverage containing 1.0 × 108 CFU/mL of LcS for 28 days. The change in stool consistency was measured as primary outcome. The stool short chain fatty acid and gut microbiota were also assessed.

primary_outcome.description: Stool consistency accessed by Britol Stool Form Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in stool short chain fatty acid content

arm_group.description: Patients with hard stool (accessed by Bristol Stool Form Scale, average score < 3) received dietary supplement with Lactobacaiilus casei strain Shirota.
patients with normal stool (accessed by Bristol Stool Form Scale, average score between 3 and 4) received dietary supplement with Lactobacaiilus casei strain Shirota.
patients with Soft stool (accessed by Bristol Stool Form Scale, average score > 4)received dietary supplement with Lactobacaiilus casei strain Shirota.

intervention.description: a bottle of 100 mililiter probiotic diary beverage containing 10^8 CFU Lactobacillus casei strain Shirota every day after lunch.
